etymology.description: Phonetic: 人(人) (rén, "person") + Semantic: 言(言) (yán, "words") = person speaking words -> trust, letter, believe
etymology.interpretation: 信(xìn, "trust; letter; believe") combines 人(人) (rén, "person") as the phonetic element with 言(言) (yán, "words") to signify the concept of words spoken by a person, which relates to trust and belief. The presence of 言(言) emphasizes the communicative aspect, hence extending the meaning to include letters.

examples.chinese: 他信我(他信我)，因为我总是守时(因為我總是守時)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xìn wǒ, yīnwèi wǒ zǒngshì shǒushí.
examples.english: He trusts me because I am always punctual.

examples.chinese: 我写信给朋友(我寫信給朋友)。
examples.english: I write a letter to a friend.

examples.chinese: 请信自己的选择(請信自己的選擇)。
